sentence.text: Review of exome sequencing data of the proband and her unaffected son for 40 known genes causing congenital nonsyndromic cataracts revealed two variants, namely c.139G>A (p.Asp47Asn; D47N) in the gap junction-mediated intercellular transport gene and c.2036C>T in the FYCO1 gene to be potentially pathogenic.

The mutation c.139G>A in the gap junction-mediated intercellular transport gene detected in the present study was also previously reported in Caucasian and Chinese families but with different phenotypes, i.e. nuclear and nuclear pulverulent cataracts.
